title: Overview
description: Provides a comprehensive introduction to AIGNE Hub, outlining the problems it solves, its core capabilities, key benefits, and the overall system architecture. This section serves as the primary entry point for understanding the product's value proposition for infrastructure management.

title: Getting Started
description: A task-oriented guide designed to get AIGNE Hub deployed and operational in under 30 minutes. It covers initial installation, provider configuration, and basic usage patterns tailored for DevOps and SRE teams.

title: Deployment Scenarios
description: Details the primary operational modes for AIGNE Hub. This section provides architectural guidance and configuration specifics for deploying as an internal enterprise gateway or as a public-facing, monetized service.

title: Enterprise Self-Hosting
description: Focuses on the configuration and management of AIGNE Hub for internal use. Covers security perimeter considerations, direct provider billing, and integration with internal OAuth systems.

title: Service Provider Mode
description: Explains how to enable and configure the credit-based billing system. This includes setting up the Payment Kit, defining custom pricing models, and managing user credits for a multi-tenant service.

title: Core Features
description: A detailed reference for the key functionalities of AIGNE Hub. This section serves as a technical deep-dive into the platform's capabilities, from AI model interactions to security and analytics.

title: Provider Management
description: Covers the connection, configuration, and management of upstream AI providers. Includes details on handling credentials, setting base URLs, and enabling/disabling specific services.

title: Usage & Cost Analytics
description: Provides guidance on monitoring system-wide and per-user consumption. Explains how to query usage statistics, track costs, and interpret the data models for billing and reporting.

title: Security & Access
description: Details the security architecture, including OAuth integration, encrypted API key storage, role-based access control (RBAC), and audit logging mechanisms for maintaining a secure deployment.

title: API Reference
description: Technical documentation for the AIGNE Hub RESTful API endpoints. Provides specifications for chat completions, image generation, and embeddings, enabling robust backend integrations.

title: Chat Completions
description: Detailed specification for the chat completions endpoint, including request/response schemas, streaming support, and model-specific parameters. Essential for building conversational AI applications.

title: Image Generation
description: Reference for the image generation endpoint. Covers supported models, parameters for size and quality, and response formats for integrating AI-powered image creation.

title: Embeddings
description: Documentation for the embeddings endpoint. Explains how to generate vector representations of text for use in semantic search, clustering, and other machine learning tasks.

title: Authentication
description: Explains how to securely authenticate requests to the AIGNE Hub API using OAuth and API keys, covering token generation and usage for programmatic access.

title: Release Notes
description: Details updates, new features, bug fixes, and other changes for each version of AIGNE Hub. This section helps DevOps and SRE teams track the evolution of the platform and plan for upgrades.
